feedback: The remediation uses ad‑hoc sed commands that may not be idempotent and can be overwritten by network managers; it also does not ensure the file is empty before adding entries and lacks verification of existing configuration. Consider using a declarative approach (e.g., NetworkManager or resolvconf) and explicitly manage /etc/resolv.conf.
concerns: Direct modification of /etc/resolv.conf may be overwritten
No check for existing valid configuration before appending
Lacks atomic replacement to avoid partial state
suggested_improvements: Use NetworkManager or resolvconf to set DNS servers declaratively
Replace the file atomically (e.g., write to a temporary file then mv)
Add a check to ensure only two nameserver lines are present
